comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content: The National Probate Calendar (Index of Wills & Administrations) records the following; EWEN Henry Spencer MC of Crowhurst, Kingsdown, Sevenoaks, Kent. Lieutenant 23rd Battalion London Regiment died 5th April 1918, France. Probate London 19th June to Spencer Ewen, Farm Bailiff. Effect £167 13s 3d. His Military Cross citation in the London Gazette of 16 July 1918 reads; “”2nd Lt Henry Spencer Ewen, London Rgt. For conspicuous gallantry and devotion to duty. He organised and supervised the construction of a communications trench under heavy shell fire. Though he was twice badly shaken by bursting shells, he showed great courage and disregard of danger, and encouraged his men, when casualties were caused among them, by his splendid example.” The 1891 census records him, two years old, living with his parents Spencer [b.1853 Tydd St Mary, Cambridgeshire] and Evelina [b.1856, Bexhill, Sussex], older sister Kathleen Evelina Mary [b.1887 Mayfield, Sussex], a sister-in-law of one of his parents and a domestic servant. They are living at Hye House and his father’s occupation is recorded as Farmer. The premises still exist and is now a “Luxury Spa”. Here is a link to the premises website. crowhurst.east-sussex.co.uk/directory/1368/hye-house/ The 1901 census records the family living at a different address [unreadable] along with his father’s sister.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: The War Graves Photographic project twgpp.org/information.php?id=617904 Details written on grave but no photo of grave Cemetery: Halstead (St. Margaret) Churchyard Country: England Area: Kent Rank: Lieutenant Official Number: Unit: 1st/23rd Bn. London Regiment Force: Army Nationality: British Details: M C 5th April 1918. Killed in action near Albert, France. Age 29. Son of Spencer and Felecia Evelina Ewen of The Nook, Badger's Mount, Halstead, Sevenoaks, Kent. No known Grave-commemorated on Arras Memorial, Bay 9 or 10. Remembered on family grave.

EWEN Henry Spencer  birth date registered 4th qr 1888  Uckfield 2b123
District Uckfield spans the boundaries of the counties of Sussex and East Sussex.
